1.text: The proverbs of Solomon, the son of David, king of Israel:

2.text: to know wisdom and instruction; to discern the words of understanding;

3.text: to receive instruction in wise dealing, in righteousness, justice, and equity;

4.text: to give prudence to the simple, knowledge and discretion to the young man:

5.text: that the wise man may hear, and increase in learning; that the man of understanding may attain to sound counsel:

6.text: to understand a proverb, and parables, the words and riddles of the wise.

7.text: The fear of Yahweh is the beginning of knowledge; but the foolish despise wisdom and instruction.

8.text: My son, listen to your father’s instruction, and don’t forsake your mother’s teaching:

9.text: for they will be a garland to grace your head, and chains around your neck.

10.text: My son, if sinners entice you, don’t consent.

11.text: If they say, “Come with us, Let’s lay in wait for blood; let’s lurk secretly for the innocent without cause;

12.text: let’s swallow them up alive like Sheol, and whole, like those who go down into the pit.

13.text: We’ll find all valuable wealth. We’ll fill our houses with spoil.

14.text: You shall cast your lot among us. We’ll all have one purse.”

15.text: My son, don’t walk in the way with them. Keep your foot from their path,

16.text: for their feet run to evil. They hurry to shed blood.

17.text: For in vain is the net spread in the sight of any bird:

18.text: but these lay wait for their own blood. They lurk secretly for their own lives.

19.text: So are the ways of everyone who is greedy for gain. It takes away the life of its owners.

20.text: Wisdom calls aloud in the street. She utters her voice in the public squares.

21.text: She calls at the head of noisy places. At the entrance of the city gates, she utters her words:

22.text: “How long, you simple ones, will you love simplicity? How long will mockers delight themselves in mockery, and fools hate knowledge?

23.text: Turn at my reproof. Behold, I will pour out my spirit on you. I will make known my words to you.

24.text: Because I have called, and you have refused; I have stretched out my hand, and no one has paid attention;

25.text: but you have ignored all my counsel, and wanted none of my reproof;

26.text: I also will laugh at your disaster. I will mock when calamity overtakes you;

27.text: when calamity overtakes you like a storm, when your disaster comes on like a whirlwind; when distress and anguish come on you.

28.text: Then will they call on me, but I will not answer. They will seek me diligently, but they will not find me;

29.text: because they hated knowledge, and didn’t choose the fear of Yahweh.

30.text: They wanted none of my counsel. They despised all my reproof.

31.text: Therefore they will eat of the fruit of their own way, and be filled with their own schemes.

32.text: For the backsliding of the simple will kill them. The careless ease of fools will destroy them.

33.text: But whoever listens to me will dwell securely, and will be at ease, without fear of harm.”
